definition[0]: a British company that makes fashionable clothing for women, jewellery and cosmetics. It is named after the woman who started it. Mary Quant had a big influence on the fashion of the 1960s, and she is considered by some people to be the inventor of the miniskirt.
definition[1]: (1934â€“)  a British fashion designer, who had a great influence on the fashions of the 1960s. She is best known for her clothes with geometric patterns and is considered by some people to be the inventor of the mini skirt.
